title.narrative: Protecting livestock assets and safeguarding livelihoods affected by severe drought in Kenya’s Arid and Semi-Arid Lands

description.narrative: This FAO project aims to protect livestock assets and safeguard livelihoods affected by severe drought in Kenya’s Arid and Semi-Arid Lands. With its implementing partners, FAO will implement livestock assets and safeguarding livelihoods activities in the counties facing the highest vulnerability during this drought. The counties targeted include Marsabit, Samburu, Isiolo, and Baringo. These are among the counties among the twelve (12) counties identified by NDMA(Long rains assessment report-LRA) to be at the alert stage, worsening the situation. The project will provide emergency support to approximately 20,643 pastoralist households (99,858 individuals) by providing benefits from the emergency distribution of animal feed and animal health support through the treatment of livestock. In total, 99,858 persons will be targeted, including 23,829 women 15,978 men and 60,051 children . FAO also expects 14,979 people with disabilities to be among those targeted
